name: 1862 David Walley's Restaurant and Saloon
review description: Unusual locale cuisine items, ample portions, great presentation, very well prepared and delicious, perhaps a bit pricey. Service was great without being fawning.

name: The Ahwahnee Hotel Dining Room - Ahwahnee Hotel
review description: This year we had lunch, the year before we had breakfast. We were disappointed both times and my husband and I decided we will not return there to eat in our lifetime. the service is mediocre; the food just okay. And when the dinning room is that empty as it was for lunch we should have gotten the best table with a view and we didn't instead we were stuck in the middle of the dinning room. As I said very disappointing...

name: Apres Wine Co.
address: 3668 Lake Tahoe Blvd Ste G South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
review description: Fun place. More wine bar than restaurant but food good and eclectic. Great place to try many different wines.

name: Austria Hof Restaurant
review description: We will return. Food was good and wait staff was attentive.

name: Bar of America & Pacific Crest Grill
review description: Recently met friends in Truckee for dinner at the Pacific Crest Grill on a Saturday eve in April 2012 There was good menu variety, reasonable prices and good food. The grill/bar area has a nice ambience--natural wood and brick. I would recommend this restaurant for a low key evening out.

name: Baxters Bistro & Lounge
review description: location location locationFood was only passing the last couple times here. Used to be so good.Worst was when they ran out of bread and set a plate of hamburger buns on the table and expected us to not know they were hamburger buns. It was great for a laugh though.

name: Beaujolais Bistro
review description: The staff was very attentive. The food was great! Will come back the next time we're in town again.

name: Big Water Grille
review description: Great view of the mountains. Food was ok (short ribs and cheesy polenta) but over priced for what it is. Decor needs to be updated (ie. table cloth looked old and had a few holes). Service was very friendly and attentive.

name: Briscola - Reno
review description: Both the appetizers and wine were wonderful... We had the calamari and the stuffed peppers. The entrees however were a huge disappointment .My husband had the veal parm... The veal was terribly tough and covered with a flavorless tomato sauce. My choice was the mushroom "pillows". I am a huge fan of mushroom ravioli and thought it would be similar...it wasn't and was an overall unpleasant dish. Our wait staff... two terrific ladies, we're attentive and most pleasant. We should have complained about the entrees but we didn't, mainly because of their exceptional service!!!

name: Campo
review description: Wonderful food, place everything. Cannot believe we didnt know about this place for 3 years.

name: Charlie Palmer Steak - Reno
review description: Having worked eight years in the casino industry I have experienced my fair share of restaurant programs contained within resorts. Charlie Palmer Steak is a formidable effort for fine dining. The food was mostly good; our halibut dish was a bit dry / over-seared and the sauce was scant. The seafood platter was tasty, but again, a bit light for the price. As a food lover from the Bay Area – a wonderful mecca of fresh, organic, progressive dining options – my hopes were that this would hit near the mark I am accustomed to. I can say that this was some of the better dining I experienced in Reno. The service, while friendly, was a bit overbearing and could have been more perceptive about our needs for table conversation. Noisy.

name: Chart House Restaurant - Lake Tahoe
review description: This is our "special" place to go, anytime we're celebrating us and being in love this is where we go

name: Chart House Restaurant - Mammoth Lakes
address: 106 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
review description: Not up to the Charts Hose in Alexandria or Annapolis

name: Christy Hill
review description: What a find! Every table had an outstanding view! We were greeted and seated immediately and even offered a choice of inside or outside even though the restaurant was jumping! We were seated in a small booth the hosted called "The snuggle booth" we sat side by side and faces the gorgeous lake and watched the sun set. The food was amazing both in taste and presentation! Rich our waiter was both charming and extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of both food and wine! The wine list was sensational. Christy Hill is now on my short list of favorite restaurants!

name: CJ's Grill
address: 343 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
review description: Good food at a fair price. The hot soft pretzel bites (appetizer) were exceptional. The tasty soap was served hot. The BBQ chicken and BBQ platter entrees were both good. We did note that bread and butter were not served with the meal (ok with us). CJ's Grill is recommended for a decent meal at a fair price.

name: DaVinci
address: One South Lake Street Reno, NV  89501
review description: A new chef has proven to be a wise move; the food has improved. During dinner, lighting, cameras and personnel to film and make what I assumed would be advertising appeared with no word from management that this would be occurring. Not a very professional or proper way to treat paying guests. Lee remains a terrific waiter.

name: Dragonfly Restaurant and Sushi Bar
review description: We met friends for lunch, our first time there, not theirs. We all thought the food was marvelous, the atmosphere was friendly, the service was top rate.

name: Edgewood Restaurant
review description: Very noisy which detracted from the beautiful view.

name: Fredrick's Fusion Bistro
review description: The food was very good and the staff was very nice. I'd go back for seconds.

name: Jake's on the Lake
address: 780 North Lake Boulevard Tahoe City, CA  96145
review description: Several in our party of 11 found the food to be a little bland. The highlight was the short ribs.

name: JB Mapes & Co.
review description: Nice neighborhood restaurant in a good location. Food is enjoyable but nothing remarkable. Waiter was attentive and well intentioned.

name: La Strada - Eldorado Hotel Casino
review description: My husband and I have lived in Reno for decades. La Strada is our favorite restaurant hands down. In all the years going to La Strada, the food and service have never wavered from being absolutely excellent. We love to take friends or family there when they visit Reno, and they all rave about it as well. We always go there for our anniversary, special occasions- and often, just because! The Carano family and Eldorado, as well as La Strada are elegant and wonderful. All these years they consistantly join food, wine, service, dessert and ambience and hit them all out of the park, every time. They make every experience special. Thank you so much. Simply perfection- don't change a thing!Nicole and Steve Hadley

name: Lakeside Beach Grill
address: 4081 Lakeshore Blvd South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
review description: How can you beat sitting on a beach at Lake Tahoe with glass windscreens to shield you from the elements? The view can't be beat, the food is decent and the wait personnel certainly try hard to please. I'll go back. Just don't expect haute cuisine and you'll be satisfied.

name: Le Bistro (Incline Village)
address: 120 Country Club Drive Ste 29 Incline Village, NV  89451
review description: Food is good but service is lacking.

name: The Lodge
review description: Good food but very expensive for small portions. Sea Bass for $34 is a bit pricey.

name: Lone Eagle Grille
address: 111 Country Club Dr. Incline Village, NV  89451
review description: We had a great time. The service was excellent especially a waitress who come to the USA from Romania. My wife, and friends all remarked on how attentive she was- well done Miss Romania !!The food was on time, well cooked and presented.Overall a very nice experience.

name: Manzanita at The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe
address: 13031 Ritz Carlton Highlands Court Truckee, CA  96161
review description: An absolutely amazing experience at this wonderful location. The food was terrific: despite a few misses, such as the dessert couse where the chocolate mousse was not very creamy and the raspberry smear was gritty we had the Heirloom Tomato Salad which took Insalata Caprese to a whole new level, a risotto with a variety of mushrooms ( & truffles), the avocado soup was ridiculous good and went very well with the sparkling wine that was recommended and the mussels had this amazing broth and grilled bread that was lick-the-bowl good and we also had a potato salad that was like no other. Our cocktails were perfect and well made (cucumber mojito my favorite) and the wine pairings were spot-on. We will be going back! No real view however!

name: Moody's Bistro Bar & Beats
review description: Moody's is our "go to" place in Truckee. We average once or twice a month. Casual, excellent food and good wine list. If anything the food has improved over the last several months. Would recommend to anyone who finds themselves in Truckee and in need of a meal.

name: PlumpJack Cafe Squaw Valley
address: 1920 Squaw Valley Road Olympic Valley, CA  96146
review description: Not as good as pasted visits but still above many others. Yes, we'll be back.

name: The Prime Rib Grill - Eldorado Hotel Casino
review description: Each time we go to Reno we have dinner here. The salad and soup bar is excellent with cold salad plates. This time we went we had a show later that evening so we had the early bird special. We all ordered the prime rib but we felt our meat was a little on the tough side at first we thought it was our knives. The funny thing we were casino hopping and decided to try a buffet for lunch and they were serving prime rib and we thought the prime rib was more tender and we were able to cut our meat in one cut. We all ordered medium rare and had either mashed or baked potato along with broccoli. We love the atmosphere. Hostess and server was friendly. Probably will return many choices in Reno we come from a city with good prime rib restaurants.

name: The Rafters
address: 220 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
review description: They had no idea we even had a reservation.

name: Rim - Grand Sierra Resort & Casino
review description: The food wasn't as good as we expected.

name: River Ranch Lodge & Restaurant
review description: .Great outdoor patio seating by the river====Fried green tomatoes were OUTSTANDING//// Server was competent, but slow.JA.

name: Roxy - Eldorado Hotel Casino
review description: Service and food was excellent as usual

name: Scusa Italian Ristorante
address: 2543 Lake Tahoe Boulevard South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
review description: Mama Mia! An Italian restaurant with no expresso machine?!!I wouldn't call that very Italian....

name: Six Peaks Grille
address: 400 Squaw Creek Road Olympic Valley, CA  96146
review description: Enjoyed the meal very much. My filet mignon was tender and flavorful, the wedge salad with pear and blue cheese the best I have ever had. Enjoyed the wine flight expertly paired with our meal. My dining companion had the short ribs and they were fall-off-the-bone and dark-glazed wonderful. The service was friendly and smart but lacked the level of attention that would have brought the experience to the level of "excellent."

name: SoDo
review description: Second time to Sodo. Service was good, but a bit slow. Food is consistently excellent, with the exception of the soups. Spiced more heavily than many people prefer. Overall a very good addition to the Reno dining scene

name: Spindleshanks
address: 6873 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe Vista, CA  96148
review description: Avoid. Began poorly when not acknowledged upon entering.Poor service, very long wait for dinner. My entree was appetizer size, which whenconveyed to my waiter he ignored me and walked off. My family was surprised by his cavalier attitude.We're not difficult people, we just don't like be snubbed by our waiter.Whole experience was disappointing. North Lake Tahoe has so many other fantastic choices please try them instead.

name: The Steakhouse at Circus - Reno
review description: this is such an understated little gem of a place: we've come here for years, but haven't been in a while and were happy to discover it's even better than before...superb food, great ambiance - your prices have increased also - but the meal was well worth it. So accessible yet so hidden: right next door to the kids' circus gameroom but once you shut the door, it's in its own private world...we'll be back.

name: Sterling's Seafood Steakhouse at Silver Legacy Resort Casino
review description: As always everything was excellent. This is one of our favorite places to dine in Reno.

name: Sunnyside
address: 1850 West Lake Blvd Tahoe City, CA  96145
review description: Wonderful view but the food was so-so. Haven't been here in years so wanted to see if was still as great - I think it's become such a tourist trap. Sure, the view is amazing, but my cocktail was watered down and the food was bland. Best thing we had was the flat bread appetizer.

name: Tamarack Junction Steak House
review description: So happy to no longer drive to downtown Reno for a five-star meal. This restaurant has only been open a week, but you would NEVER guess that. The service was impeccable. The steak was the best I have had in Reno, and was cooked exactly as I requested. While the prices are a little high for this end of town, the food quality, amount of food and service more than compensate. It was a little loud the night we were there - the restaurant was full and we actually had an 8 person group that they placed in the center of the room, which tends to make it noisier. However, the perimeter of the room is all booths - big, comfy, upholstered booths that I imagine are very quiet and comfortable enough to fall asleep in after this awesome meal!

name: Vivoli Cafe & Trattoria - Reno
address: 6795 So. Virginia Street Suite H Reno, NV  89511
review description: First visit to this cafe. We went for our wedding anniversary. We were treated very well. We felt very welcome. The food was good, it was hot and tasty. not exceptional, but good. We have had alot worst in other places. We will go back, nice place, decent service, decent prices. Ambiance was spartan: very euro styled.

name: West Shore Cafe
review description: We sat out on the deck on a nice evening. Dinner was great and the views were fantastic.

name: Whitebark
review description: There is a new chef here and that is a good thing because when we were here a year ago the food quality had declined from previous years. The new chef has simply set a new high standard. Appetizers to dessert were special. Foodies will appreciate the flavors and care this chef puts into his work. Awesome. Well worth a visit.

name: Wild Alaskan Restaurant and Bar
review description: The menu offered unique items like my Salmon wrap and my spouse's Halibut burger (more like a sandwich than a burger, but still...). They had some different beers on tap (Lost Coast Tangerine Wheat that I had). The owner was our server and everything was just so pleasant. It's a bit hard to find, tucked into the corner of a shopping center but if you find Raley's turn around and you'll see their sign. I'm so glad we found this place. It was nice to have something different for lunch than the typical burger and fries lunch! The owner says the place really gets hopping in the summer so it might be a fun bar scene in the middle of summer, but our spring lunch was just nice, quiet, and relaxed.

name: Wolfdale's Cuisine Unique
address: 640 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe City, CA  96145
review description: Has an asian flair that was not described well in the menu - no specials on a saturday night?
